SLAM.title: Understanding why SLAM algorithms fail in modern indoor environments
context: This paper presents an evaluation strategy and datasets to test and compare simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) algorithms in complex indoor environments. State-of-the-art SLAM algorithms were analyzed based on metrics such as trajectory error, scale drift, and map accuracy. Results show that SLAM algorithms often fail in challenging environments with dynamic objects and reflective/transparent surfaces. Successful loop closures greatly impact performance, emphasizing the need for further research to improve algorithm robustness in real-world scenarios.
本文提出了一种评估策略和数据集，用于在复杂的室内环境中测试和比较同时定位和地图构建（SLAM）算法。基于轨迹误差、尺度漂移和地图精度等指标，分析了最先进的SLAM算法。结果表明，在具有动态物体、反射/透明表面的复杂环境中，SLAM算法经常失败。成功的回环检测对算法性能产生了重大影响，强调了需要进一步研究以提高算法在实际环境中的鲁棒性。

NeRF.title: PET-NeuS: Positional Encoding Tri-Planes for Neural Surfaces
context: This paper presents PET-NeuS, an extension of the NeuS method for neural surface reconstruction using a signed distance function (SDF) parametrized by an MLP. PET-NeuS introduces three new components: a tri-plane representation to improve data structure, a new positional encoding to combat noise, and learnable convolution operations using self-attention convolution to produce features with different frequency bands. Experiments show that PET-NeuS achieves high-fidelity surface reconstruction on standard datasets, improving upon the NeuS baseline by 57% on Nerf-synthetic and by 15.5% on DTU. Code is available at the provided GitHub link.

本文介绍PET-NeuS，这是一种使用由MLP参数化的有符号距离函数（SDF）进行神经表面重建的NeuS方法的扩展。PET-NeuS引入了三个新组件：三面体平面表示法以改进数据结构，新的位置编码以对抗噪声，以及使用自注意力卷积进行可学习卷积操作以生成具有不同频带的特征。实验结果表明，PET-NeuS在标准数据集上实现了高保真表面重建，在Nerf-synthetic上改进了57％，在DTU上改进了15.5％。代码可在提供的GitHub链接中找到。

NeRF.title: NerfAcc: Efficient Sampling Accelerates NeRFs
context: This paper investigates and compares multiple sampling approaches for optimizing and rendering Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF), and demonstrates that improved sampling is generally applicable across NeRF variants under a unified concept of transmittance estimator. The authors develop NerfAcc, a Python toolbox that provides flexible APIs for incorporating advanced sampling methods into NeRF-related methods, which can reduce the training time of several recent NeRF methods by 1.5x to 20x with minimal modifications to the existing codebase. Additionally, highly customized NeRFs, such as Instant-NGP, can be implemented in native PyTorch using NerfAcc.

本文研究并比较多种采样方法，以优化和渲染神经辐射场（NeRF），并表明在透射率估计器的统一概念下，改进采样通常适用于各种NeRF变体。作者开发了NerfAcc，这是一个Python工具箱，提供了灵活的API，可将高级采样方法纳入NeRF相关方法中，最小限度地修改现有代码库即可将几种最近的NeRF方法的训练时间缩短1.5倍至20倍。此外，可以使用NerfAcc在本地PyTorch中实现高度定制的NeRF，例如Instant-NGP。
